However, the overridden method should call @B_android#preference#Preference#callChangeListener_E@ to make sure the client wants to update the preference's state with the new value.

setDialogMessage(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the message of the dialog. This will be shown on subsequent dialogs. This message forms the content View of the dialog and conflicts with list-based dialogs, for example. If setting a custom View on a dialog via @B_android#preference#DialogPreference#setDialogLayoutResource_E@, include a text View with ID @B_android#R#id#message_E@ and it will be populated with this message.

ClassDesc: Use the A base class for @B_android#preference#Preference_E@ objects that are dialog-based. These preferences will, when clicked, open a dialog showing the actual preference controls.
